children.text:
SAM has been funded and developed by the University of the West of England, Bristol, in collaboration with MyOxygen, Bristol.

Development team:
Phil Topham, Praminda Caleb-Solly, Paul Matthews

Acknowledgements
Thanks to the following for giving permission to use quotations or self-help material:

Centre for Clinical Interventions, Western Australia.
Daniel Kahneman, Princeton University.
GET.gg Self-Help and Therapy Resources, Guernsey.
Richard Kinnier, Arizona State University.
Richard M. McFall, Indiana University.
World Health Organisation, Switzerland.

Thanks to the following for their contributions to the development and establishment of SAM:

Allen Bennett; Andrew Parsons; Andrew Wilson; Ane Gillett; Annie Shaw; Bev Green; Clare Clark; Clinical Psychology Forum; Danielle Sinnett; David Coward; Diane Zimmer; Elizabeth Dartnall; Hannah Davies; Helen Baker; Helen Farmer; Jacqui Rae; Jane Foley; Jane Simmons; Janet Brandling; Jenny Lloyd; John Rushforth; Karen Garmston; Katherine Baly; Katie Gough; Kaye Barnett; Kieran Kelly; Kim Scarborough; Kirstie Adamson; Lawrie Jones; Lesley Drake; Liza McCarron; Martin Robinson; Mary Mooney; Miya Bond; Neil Finlay; Nick Biggs; Paul Redford; Rachel Clark; Rachel Grimstead; Rich Egan; Richard Manley; Ruth McIlroy; Sid Baldwin; Sue Meads; Uday Thakur; UWE Students' Union.

The development team would especially like to thank all the people who took part in user trials of SAM and its prototypes.

Contact us with your suggestions for improving SAM. Contact us if you are interested in partnering with UWE on research and development of SAM and related projects. http://sam-app.org.uk
